text: INT. KITCHEN —- MARIUM HOME - NIGHT Susan prepares a plate at the stove: spaghetti and sauce bread. She brings it over and sets it down for... Marium, waiting at the table with his hands steepled befo his face. Band-Aids on his face. Sunken. Haunted. She joins him with her own plate, eyeing him, concerned b understanding. Oh, he notices his food there.

...thank you... She touches his hand. He gives her a frail, phony smile.  81. She frowns at that, don’t, and he lets the smile go. Lets see the grief in his face. Holds her hand tightly. A moment like that and then they both look up to... Core, returning to his plate, carefully replacing his nap in his lap. He looks a shell of himself, utterly depleted Susan reaches for the bottle of wine, gestures to pour hi some. Core hesitates then slides his glass over with a no He takes a sip, looks around at this modest, new-model ho Cream-colored paint and particle-board cabinets.
Your home is lovely. Susan smiles but it doesn’t quite reach her eyes. They eat. Utensils clink on plates.
Donald says you're a writer.
I write. Yes.
What kinds of stories?
I write about nature. I’m not sure if that’s a story.
Is it fulfilling? She was maybe asking to be polite but Core stares intense down into his plate, like the truth might be hidden there

You do a thing and...at some point that’s what you are. I don’t know if that’s the same. But I loved wolves very much. I used to study them. Lived with them for a time. Near them, anyway. (he’s seeing them now) They were very beautiful. Marium looks up from his food, glances at Susan: this nak emotion is awkward at the dinner table. Core realizes this, is embarrassed.  82. CORE (CONT’D) (gesturing, your baby) Um. How much longer do you have? Susan can’t help but to smile, touching her big belly.
February. Core smiles in a vague and longing kind of way.
Almost here. (beat) Do you know what you’re having? She shakes her head, adding...
He wants a boy though. Now Marium can’t help but to smile.
No, a girl is good, too. A fogey like me having his first kid? Anything is fine.
What are you...forty?
Forty three.
“Fogey.” Hah. I’1l trade with you. A beat, the two men regarding each other, Susan watching.
Are you a father? Core blinks. Swallows hard.
Yes.
What’s his name? Her name? Core swallows. Just saying it breaks his heart...  83.
(very quiet) Amy. Marium refills Core’s glass, then Susan’s, then his own.
What’s it like? He considers his answer... He shrugs,
Amazing. I wish I’d understood that better at the time. I think I thought she would love me by nature of that fact that I existed. That that would be enough, without being there.
You traveled for your work.
When I was younger, yes.
That was for her. To make money for her.

There are ways to make money that don’t involve being apart from your family. But even later, when I was at home...I still wasn’t there. In my little room across the hall, you know? Doing my work. his eyes shining. CORE (CONT’D) And when she had troubles, y’know, like young people do, I uh...I guess I wasn’t much help. He has a sip of wine. Lets it settle.

You like to think you're devoted to your child. You say this to people. ‘I would do anything for her. Anything.’ And it feels correct in your mouth when you say it. But then...you go ahead with your life.  84. Susan doesn’t know what to say. The phone RINGS, once, tw and on three Marium finally gets up to answer in the kitc We can hear him MURMURING in there. Core and Susan sit in silence. Her fork clinks on her plate.
Marium nods into the phone, leaning one-handed against th wall like some great weight is pulling him down by the ne

Right. Okay. Yeah. He hangs up, grips his forehead, exhales. When he opens his eyes, Core is standing in the doorway w the empty wine bottle, waiting for the news. Marium gestures at the phone, troubled...

County a few hours east of here. A man in a mining camp was killed tonight. Some recluse, sounds like. Witness spoke to the killer and described Vernon Slone perfectly. She uh...she said he wore a wolf mask. Core sets the empty bottle on the counter. Chnk.
Now what?
First light they’1l turn that whole valley upside down. He lifts his eyes to Core’s...

But if we can’t get ahead of him, more people are gonna die. INT. MAIN ROOM - SHAD’S HOUSE - NIGHT A PERCOCET PILL is crushed beneath a dollar with a lighte SHAN MARTIN (35) chops it, snorts it. He’s doughy, dull-e smeared with bad tattoos. His house is filthy: you can sm the bong water and cat piss. Abrasive METAL on the CD pla  85. ON THE MUTED TV: a solemn REPORTER outside of Cheeon’s ho COPS and AMBULANCES all over. Chyron: Massacre In Keelut. Shan watches in stoned disbelief. ON THE TV: a MUG SHOT OF CHEEON (several years old) becom SLONE’S SERVICE PHOTO with a POLICE HOTLINE NUMBER below Shan lights a cigarette, astonished. Tkk. A noise from somewhere else. He looks. TKK. He gets up, cuts the music off (the BUZZ of the space hea now the only sound in here) and listens. Freaked out. He stubs out his smoke.

The overhead bulb clicks on and Shan creeps through this chilly room (his breath already fogging) for wash sinks a mop buckets. He’s got a BASEBALL BAT cocked back. He unlocks the DOUBLE DEADBOLT on the door there and STEP INTO TOTAL DARKNESS...

.--which, click!, suddenly reveals itself to be a TWIN BA AUTO GARAGE as he hits the lights. The wind outside WHIST He edges anxiously past shelves of tools and spray cans a junk parts, a half-tarped SNOWMOBILE and a TRUCK covered rock n’ roll stickers, until-- He nears something, his face bunching in confusion. THE DOOR is opened just half an inch, bumping with the wi outside. The LATCH HOUSING is broken, forced apart. ON SHAN, gaping at it as we realize SOMEONE ELSE IS HERE. He whirls, gasping, almost dropping the bat because--

Jeezchrist! Slone is slouched in the corner, barely conscious, one BL HAND clutching his BLOOD-SOAKED SHOULDER.  86. SHAN (CONT’D) Goddamn, Vern. Been a while. (glancing to the door) Broke my door, huh?
You alone here?
What? Yeah. Shelly moved out a while back. It’s just us. Slone nods, almost dozes but struggles back into focus--
I need your help.
Y-yeah. Sure thing.
Get Cheeon for me.

Cheeon? The fuck you been, man? Slone reads the grim meaning in that. INT. BEDROOM - SHAN’S HOUSE - NIGHT SLONE, shirtless on the bed, on his stomach, facing clamm into camera while... IN THE BACKGROUND, Shan busies back and forth.

I’m sorry, man. I know you boys were tight. Cheeon never did like cops, did he? Made himself a real bloodbath up there. Goddamn. Shan crosses, collecting things. Drawers and cabinets sla SHAN (CONT’D) And the other thing...uh. They said it on the news. Bailey. Just a fucking nightmare, man. Just senseless. Medora. Fuck. Slone blinks, lizard-like. AT THE BATHROOM SINK, Shan scrubs a pair of NEEDLE-NOSE PLIERS with a wire brush and greasecutter.  87. SHAN (CONT’D) So who shot you?
A woman.

Shit...who ain’t been shot by a woman? A BOTTLE OF VODKA is set on the bedside table. And two PERCOCETS. Some WASHCLOTHS, an X-ACTO BLADE, a soup pan o HOT WATER. Slone winces as Shan kneels beside him, inspecting-- THE BULLET HOLE IN SLONE’S SHOULDER. The bleeding has slo more of a sluggish ooze now, but it’s deep and chewed ope SHAN (CONT’D) Jesus, this go through something first?
A truck.

Yeah. Looks like it came apart, alright. Probably why you're still breathing. Shan swigs the vodka, then holds it near Slone’s hand... SHAN (CONT’D) Pull on this. And take those. It’s gonna hurt like a motherfucker. Edging painfully up onto his elbow, Slone palms the pills into his mouth and glugs the bottle. As he eases back dow SHAN (CONT’D) Don’t worry, Vern. I done this a million times. Get you cleaned up, get some hot soup in you and--
What kind?
Huh?
What kind of soup?  88.
Campbell’s chicken.
I like tomato.
You been fucking shot, man. ‘I like tomato.’ Jesus Christ. Shaking his head at that, Shan bends in with the X-ACTO B to start his work and SLONE BUCKLES IN WHITE-HOT AGONY. CUT TO BLACK.

Susan lays curled on her side as Marium draws her covers Bends low to kiss her on the cheek, gently strokes her ha She looks at him with a serious kind of adoration. She whispers something to him that we cannot hear. He smiles and whispers something back.
As Marium backs out of the bedroom, quietly closing the d on the darkened room, he pauses, hearing... A faint CLINKING of dishes from elsewhere in the house.

Marium appears in the doorway, seeing that-- Core is washing the dishes. Trying to be quiet about it. Marium joins him, pours TWO GLASSES of whiskey, hands one Core. They clink glasses, not merrily, and drink. And then Marium starts to dry the dishes, put them away a Core rinses them. As they work...
Have you ever seen anything like that today?  89.

I kicked in a meth lab, few years ago. Guy took a coupla pops at me with a .22, a purse gun. Sounded like bubble wrap. He was as close to me as you are and missed every shot. Scariest moment of my entire life. (beat) No. I have never seen anything like that today.
You handled yourself.
(bitterly) I gave him what he wanted. The dishes are done. They lean there and drink, exhausted
Why did you stop? With the wolves, I mean.

Oh. There were...people... (He practically spits that word out.) CORE (CONT’D) They came onto the reservation. To camp. They brought their infant with them. Ten months old. They drank champagne and fell asleep. There was a wolf, she was starving, and she came into the tent. Marium listens in stillness. Core’s eyes are elsewhere.

The authorities, they...well. I was hired to do it and I did it. I think I felt like, better it was me than some policeman in a helicopter. Their eyes meet and hold. CORE (CONT’D) Slone killed the old woman. Marium nods.  90.
Knives aren’t Cheeon’s style. It was Slone.
And the coroner? Those policemen? Now this hermit tonight? He nods again.
Depending how this all shakes out we might never know for sure but, yes, I believe so.
Why? Marium moves his hand, a mystified gesture.

Stop us from getting to Medora first. Or to get at the boy’s body. Or maybe he’s just evil. I can’t presume to know what’s in Vernon Slone’s head. Why any of it? Why'd Medora do what she did? I’m not convinced the answers exist.
They do. Whether or not they can fit with our experience is something else.
What do you think?
I’m not a cop.
You deal in behavior. Only difference is the piece of tin. Core snorts, shakes his head. But then grows serious, thoughtful...
She said things to me. She’d been left alone with him. He was wrong, she said. It was like she wanted to fix him. Save him. I don’t know.  gl.
Save him by destroying him?
It happens in medicine. Chemotherapy.
This isn’t chemotherapy. This is a little boy. Save him from what?
The dark. Marium frowns. Waits for more.

In her. In him. Outside her window. She told me about it but I uh...I wasn’t listening. Core kills his drink, stares into the empty glass... CORE (CONT’D) I think that’s why she wrote me. It was already done by then but I think she wanted a witness to her life. To tell her story. And I think she wanted to be punished. Marium considers this, tops off his glass, and as he tops Core’s...
Well, you’re the story guy. But for the other part all she needed was to wait for Vern. And if he finds her before we do, she’1ll damn sure get her wish.
I want to go home, Detective Marium.
Donald. And you’re free to leave anytime. Marium stares out the dark window, mystified.  92.

I swear to God...soon as this is over I’m taking Susan on a beach vacation. Caribbean, someplace, hot sand and green water. He takes a slow sip, turns back, and sees that... Core is looking at him with an expression of lightning realization: oh my God.
What?
“Good place to get clean.”

MOVING OVER A TOPO MAP, elevation marks, dark smudges of forest, dots with names. There’s Keelut. Core frowns at the map on the table, wracking his brain. Marium watches, waiting, desperately hopeful. But finally
I don’t know, I can’t tell from this. It was north of Keelut but... I’m not sure how long I’d been walking. Time was strange. Marium deflates, his hopes dashed...but he presses it--

Look, if there’s even a chance...if we can find her, it might be as good as finding him. Something flickers across Core’s face, some kind of decis and he looks at Marium with a new, anxious kind of resolv
I'd know it if I saw it again. Hearing that, Marium’s fire starts to return.

SLOWLY PUSHING IN ON THE STEAMING CAVE MOUTH, with that CIRCLE OF DARK SNOWLESS GROUND spreading before it.  93. TWO PEOPLE enter frame, seen from behind, hiking towards cave with BACKPACKS and COLD WEATHER GEAR. They pause, regarding this odd sight on a bright sunny da It’s Slone and Medora. They look so much younger, out of breath but energized. They look happy. It’s some other ti
Is that it?
Hurry. They continue up towards the cave.

Steamy air and slick, craggy rock. Echoing FOOTSTEPS as.. Medora leads Slone by the hand, out of the sunlight behin them, into this warm dimness. They drop their packs, unzip their heavy coats, remove th fur-lined hats. CANDLES are brought from a pack, arranged and lit. In the soft dancing light, Medora peels out of her clothe watching as... Slone peels out of his clothes and comes towards her, smiling. As gentle as we’ve ever seen this man, like anot person entirely. They embrace at the edge of a STEAMING HOT SPRING, a deep pool of calm black water, rippling with candlelight. They kiss, hungrily, their reflections upside-down and shattering endlessly on the water’s surface. Medora reaches down between his legs, he reaches down bet hers. They claw at each other, panting and pressing. Entwined, they descend into the water.
(whisper) We'll stay here forever. In this place.  94.

(whisper) I’ll never leave you. SLOWLY PULLING AWAY from their coupling as the steam catc candlelight in eerie ways, softly splashing water and thr sounds echoing together as-- INT. BEDROOM - SHAN’S HOUSE - NIGHT SLONE’S EYES SNAP AWAKE. The lights are off but we can se the fresh wad of BANDAGE on his shoulder as he sits up. Even in darkness we see it on his face: I know where she INT. MAIN ROOM - SHAN’S HOUSE - NIGHT CLOSE ON SHAN, anxiously dragging on a smoke as he whispe into the phone--

I’m saying he’s right here, right now, in my house. What? No, he’s passed out but I don’t know for how much longer so get your people out here pronto and I want that special consideration--huh? What do you mean, weapons? No, there’s no guns but he’s carrying one big ass knife... THE PHONE CORD is plucked from its wall socket. Mid-sentence, Shan hears the line go dead and turns to se SLONE-AS-WOLF in the doorway, shirtless, mask-faced, drop the phone cord, the BOWIE KNIFE clutched in his fist. At first, Shan tries to play it off... SHAN (CONT’D) Hell’d you get that thing? Go lay down, you'll start bleeding again. Slone-As-Wolf steps in, black eye sockets locked on Shan. Shan’s mouth hangs open, lowering the phone. SHAN (CONT’D) I’m in trouble, man. It’s those pills, I’m fucked up. They got me, I'm looking at real time.  95. Slone-As-Wolf moves closer. Shan pleads with his hands-- SHAN (CONT’D) But I was gonna wake you up, get you outta here before they showed up! I swear. I’d get my good citizen points, you’d be gone, no harm done! Shan backs and slides. Slone-As-Wolf moves closer. SHAN (CONT’D) C’mon, motherfucker, I just saved your life! You show up here like this? After what you done? Asked for help and I helped you! Shan’s against the wall and prays his hands together. SHAN (CONT’D) Please, Vern. Please. We been knowin’ each other since we were kids. But Slone-As-Wolf says nothing, almost in arm’s reach now
SHAN GRABS AN ASHTRAY, HURLS IT BUT--—

head_text.subj: SLONE-AS-WOLF SLAPS IT ASIDE, SWINGS THE BOWIE KNIFE IN A

text: HAYMAKER DIRECTLY INTO SHAN’S TEMPLE--POK.--UP TO THE HIL

«..Vern... Shan goes limp as a dishrag but SLONE-AS-WOLF KEEPS HIM UPRIGHT BY THE KNIFE IN HIS SKULL, powering him across th room like a busted marionette. CUT TO BLACK. IN BLACKNESS, the THRUM of immense atmospheric chaos mixe with URGENT, BOTTOM-REGISTER MUSIC that carries over...
A STORM GATHERS OVER THE MOUNTAIN, a roiling steel-colore halo forming around the highest summit in North America. Unreal in its hugeness. The sky crackles with dark energy  96.

SLONE’S BOOTS stride mechanically forward. But of course it’s Core wearing them. He and Marium, side side in heavy outdoor gear, come briskly down the TARMAC. They see: A SMALL PLANE taking off, ANOTHER ONE already taxiing int position. Tense COPS visible in the windows. COPS in weat gear jogging by in the background. Full deployment. Up ahead, there’s a cluster of STATE POLICE CARS, where s older RANKING OFFICERS are waving Marium over. As Marium jogs ahead to confer with those men-- A STIFF WIND BLOWS, Core turns into it and blinks in awe DENALI, a black mass at once distant and enormous, swelli out of the horizon line, conjuring a STORM to its peak. He is hypnotized, swaying. Marium comes jogging back, pointing Core off towards a-- TWO-SEATER CESSNA PROP PLANE, waiting nearby, with just a AIRPORT WORKERS buzzing about it but no police. Core joins him, glancing around, realizing...
Just us? As Marium loads his gear, moving urgently--

An old KA of Slone’s was found this morning with a mail slot through his skull. Half the men are working that, the rest are assisting the camp search so I’m afraid, yeah, it’s just us. You eyeball it, I’'11 call it in. Marium climbs into the plane, checking controls and slipp on the headset with practiced familiarity. He looks out to Core as he starts the engine, VRR-RRR-RRM

(shouting over the noise) Besides...only two seats in this sucker!  97. Suddenly dizzy, Core stares at the mountain, gulping deep breaths. With the deafening ENGINE NOISE between them, Marium give him a questioning look. You ready? Core nods, Yes. It’s a lie. He climbs into the plane anyw The MUSIC is a dread-fueled, ramming-speed wall of sound.
TRACKING THE CESSNA as it speeds down the runway and, as plucked up by some invisible giant, gently leaves the gro

The MUSIC crescendos into a teeth-rattling doooooom as... THE CESSNA FLIES TOWARDS DENALI. Though it’s maybe fifty miles away, the plane looks like an insect before a great dark ziggurat. The sky all around is swollen and evil.
Core gapes at the storm gathering off the mountain...
(headset filtered) Locals call it Weathermaker.
(also) McKinley?
Denali. Please. You Lower 48ers...
Can we beat that storm?

We'll get out of its way. But Marium glances out the window and maybe isn’t all tha confident. He urges the throttle up and--  98. EXT. AERIAL —- SAME BIRD'S EYE VIEW OF THE CESSNA AT 500 FEET, moving paralle a thin stripe of ROAD cutting through the WHITENESS BELOW --but now VEERING OFF TO THE RIGHT, the road disappearing beneath them, no more man-made landmarks of any kind.

THE WHITE HAIRED YUP’IK MAN (we saw him earlier, with his boy, returning from a hunt) is readying his SNOWMOBILE wh VRRRRRM. He looks up to see the CESSNA pass over him at l altitude, vanishing as quickly as it appeared.

Marium flies in the weird half-light, the increasing clou cover making for a kind of morning dusk. Core peers out the window through binoculars, scanning th ground. He gestures to Marium, That way. Marium banks the aircraft.
THE CESSNA FLIES LOW OVER WILDERNESS, a windy stretch we might recognize from Core’s trek earlier.
Looking through the binoculars, Core suddenly straightens CORE’S POV passes over an incongruous BLACK RECTANGLE wit man-made angles, down there in the whiteness.
I think that was a snow machine.
Moving?
No.
See anyone?  99.
No.
I’m gonna loop back--
Wait-- Core lowers the binoculars, eyes fixed on a near point outside the window. He taps the glass--

There. Beyond that ridge. OUT THE RIGHT WINDOW, distant but plainly visible within LOW FLATNESS surrounded by WOODED RIDGES and CRAGGY CLIFF ...there is an almost perfect CIRCLE OF DARK SNOWLESS GRO with a thread of STEAM bending upwards from its center.
That’s it. Marium looks, sees it, gauges the terrain...
I can set us down over there. He said it like an offer, a possibility. He looks to Core Who is terrified. But he nods. Do it.
I’ll be gentle.
Fuck. Marium banks it hard. EXT. AERIAL —- SAME

Marium cinches the strap of his SCOPED WEATHERBY RIFLE ov his thick ORANGE COAT, brings up his BINOCULARS, scans th landscape. MARIUM’S POV, the icy FLATNESS extending to craggy RIDGES CLIFFS in the distance, the telltale STEAM rising beyond. He looks over to... Core, climbing out of the Cessna and tromping this way. How fresh are they?

Four. Where’s the rest of the pack?

Right. They crunch onwards towards the woods. A gust of SNOWY WIND stirs a sparkling whiteness around t Core glances over his shoulder, the RAVINE receding behin them like a sideways mouth. What?

I saw something move. Marium looks up in the same direction. A long beat, the two of them side by side, looking up at ridge. The WIND makes its faint flute-noise. CORE’S BINOCULAR POV, panning along the ridge, pausing at various places, seeing nothing...and nothing...and nothin And then seeing Slone-As-Wolf, standing on the ridge, loo down at them with his bowstring already drawn back. He's-- There is a sound like HANDCLAP and when Core looks over-- Marium is taking a single shocked step backwards with AN ARROW STICKING THROUGH HIS THROAT. But Marium’s already dead, his eyes fixed and startled. Panting in terror, Core peeks over the rocks but-- UP ON THE RIDGE, there is no sight of Slone or anything e Core wrestles the RIFLE from Marium’s shoulder and... HE RUNS, awkwardly, bounding over snowy ground towards--  103. THE RAVINE, yawning ahead of him.
Core hurtles through the passage, caroming off the icy wa his RASPY BREATHING making surreal echoes in here.

He SCREAMS, an explosion of fury and frustration and desp He sags against the ruined plane a moment, then notices-- MARIUM’S DUFFEL, tucked under the pilot’s seat. He yanks out, paws it open, pitifully hopeful but... It’s just some SOCKS. And a pint of WHISKEY. And a dog-ea BOOK. He looks to the far side of the flatness, where they flew the STORM filling the sky there, threateningly close. And he looks back the other way, towards the ravine, wher just came from. And he starts back towards the ravine.  104.

MARIUM’S BODY lays ahead, already frosting over. The pool blood under his neck is red ice. As Core passes by, there is a HOWLING nearby, several wol voices joining with the shrill wind. He glances up but... UP ON THE RIDGE, there is no movement, no sign of anyone. He continues.
THE STEAMING CAVE MOUTH looms ahead as... Core enters the clearing, scanning left and right with th rifle, approaching that strange dark spot in the Earth. More HOWLING, closer now.

Core’s silhouette appears in the cave opening, bending to come inside. He blinks rapidly, edging forward, trying to adjust his e There’s that WAXY SUBSTANCE in the cracks of the floor. H eyes track it back, deeper into the cave until he sees... SOME LIT CANDLES. Flickering in the cold breeze. And A FIRE CIRCLE, just ashes now, with the toothpick bon of a HARE scattered beside it. He sees CANNED FOOD stacked to one side, a dirty SLEEPING ROLL, a small .22 RIFLE. It was Bailey’s once, wasn’t it? He sees a PAIR OF PELT BOOTS standing next to the HOT POOL...and then realizes that they’re connected to legs. She's barely visible in the dimness. Just a shape there, he can hear her BREATHING.  105.
Medora Slone. She doesn’t answer.

Are you injured? She takes a step forward, closer to the light. Now he can her: dressed in animal skins, her sunken cheeks, her filt skin and wild hair and bright, shining eyes. CORE (CONT’D) Listen to me...we have to leave. We have to leave now. He is coming. He's coming for you. The light in the cave changes and her face seems to twist she caws in dread. Core turns. Slone-As-Wolf drops the bow, regarding her through his wo face, his breath steaming out of the snout. He stalks slowly towards her. She moans but it almost sounds like relief. He steps over Core, who watches from the cave floor as... Medora sobs, opens her arms to Slone, nodding him forward Come to me. Slone reaches out, puts both hands around her throat (she still nodding)...

text: Core’s mouth moves soundlessly, wanting to call out but knowing that he’s dying. Slone-As-Wolf pins Medora, his black eye holes empty and pitiless as he squeezes her air off.  106. And still she nods, Yes, yes, yes. He squeezes. Her mouth wags like a beached fish. Not much longer. But then her hands move to his mask, her fingers spiderin over the fur, pulling it back to reveal his face... Which is full not of rage...but of bottomless tear-streak anguish. Their faces are inches apart. Their white-blonde hair, th grey-gold eyes. Core sees this. A terrible understanding. She pulls Slone’s face to hers. Puts her mouth on his. Th breathe into each other, making animal noises of hurt and hunger. She claws at Slone’s clothing. He claws at hers. They sin down together, knocking the CANDLES over as they coil ont each other’s bodies. New trickles of SPILLED CANDLE WAX snake across the cave floor, winding past Core’s face. He sees this happen as we... FADE TO BLACK.

Core’s eyes open, bleary, pain-fogged. He turns his head. Vernon Slone emerges from the darkness, naked, coming tow Core with something in his hand. In the shadows behind him, we glimpse Medora, watching th as she dresses. Slone stands over Core, looking down without expression.
...the...the boots...
What?
...they’re yours...  107. Slone kneels beside him, lights the cigarettes in his han and holds it to Core’s mouth for a drag.

You keep them. Core inhales, nods gratefully, lets the smoke drizzle out Slone looks out towards the mouth of the cave, where the FREEZING WIND keens and the LIGHT seems to fade. And he turns his gaze down to Core, questioning but patie
Well...what do you want? Core knows what he is asking. His eyes fill with tears. He looks to Medora, who stares back at him in something almost like tenderness. He looks back to Slone...
CORE’S DRIPPING HAND In the bathtub the other night, hovering over the razor.
He swallows painfully. Lifts his head, just a bit, to ans with a whispered certainty...
I'd rather live. Slone nods slowly, accepting Core’s decision. He holds th cigarette out to him for one more drag and... SLONE YANKS THE ARROW OUT.

Core returns to half-consciousness and sees that Slone is dressed, packing the last of Medora’s provisions.  108. Medora is beside him, bundled in layers of skins and furs lacing up her boots. She notices Core is awake, straightens, looking at him th way a parent looks at a heartbroken child.

(softly) You understand about the sky now, don’t you? He just stares back at her, his non-answer a kind of Yes. They shoulder their packs and the rifle, stand there for moment, solemnly staring down at Core. And then they walk past him, on out of the cave without another word. Grunting with pain and effort, Core rolls over to see out the CAVE OPENING where... OUT THERE, Slone and Medora walk away together, gradually disappearing into a blast of snowy wind.

CORE CRAWLS. Snow and wind lash at his face, his beard is caked with ice. He drags himself over the ground with one elbow, his other deadened arm dragging along. But it’s a progress of inches. He’s not going to make it of here. His face is gnarled with the boring agony of it He stops, resting his face in the snow, heaving for breat the weather hammers down on him. And when he finally lifts his head again, he is not at al surprised to see... THE WOLVES, all of them, gathered on the ridge above him gazing down like some kind of council in judgment. A quiet moment. Core and these animals. His face is too frozen for much expression...but he is no afraid. If anything, he seems to welcome what will come n CUT TO BLACK. SILENCE. And then a strange BUZZING...a motor? Coming clo  109.

FRAGMENTED IMAGES, CORE’S HAZY POV: SNOW BLOWS SIDEWAYS and THUNDER RUMBLES. A GOGGLED FACE bends down towards us out of the storm, inspecting us. And now we see... A SNOWMOBILE, nearby, where two FIGURES are hauling a DEA ELK CALF off of the attached SLED. GLOVED HANDS drag us towards this sled.

THE ENGINE RUMBLES and Core slides along the ground, bouncing, bundled under a tarp. He cranes his neck to see It’s the WHITE-HAIRED YUP’IK MAN driving the snowmobile, hunched into the wind, with his BOY riding behind him. As they near the RAVINE, Core catches a brief glimpse of. SCRAPS OF SHREDDED ORANGE COAT IN A SMEAR OF BLOODY SNOW. The Boy looks back, peers at Core through his dark goggle Says something that can’t be heard over the engine.
...what?
They spared you. Core lays back, stares up into the churning sky as... THE SNOWMOBILE IS SWALLOWED BY THE RAVINE.

CORE, naked on a cot in some DARK CABIN as SEVERAL YUP’IK WOMEN wash him by firelight. They use plastic water bottles with holes in the caps to squirt water over him, wiping away the blood with sponges Someone cleans the ARROW WOUND with alcohol, slathers antibiotic ointment on it. Core doesn’t feel it. The fire throws crazy shadows. The air is hazed with smok His head tips sideways and he sees...  110. AN OLDER BLONDE WOMAN (60s) watching from the corner with expression. She’s tall and gaunt, in a tattered old anora Tired _grey-gold eyes. The only other white person here. She comes near, looks wearily down at Core a long moment. then bends down to pick up... SLONE’S BOOTS, waiting beside the cot with the rest of Co blood-soaked clothes. Core watches her turn and leave the cabin, his view of he now obscured by the Yup’ik Women and their cleaning of hi CUT TO BLACK.

Clean-shaven now, Core fades back to consciousness, disoriented and weak. Hospital sounds, beeps and murmurs. His lips are chapped and split, the skin of his cheeks pi and flaking, a bruise puffed under one eye. Hurts to swal His eyes fall on something and he stares at it for a long long beat. If he never looked away, that would be fine. A WOMAN (30s), asleep in a chair by his bedside in a holi sweater and horn-rimmed glasses, a newspaper in her lap. The moment stretches, Core gazing at her in love and sadn
Amy. She wakes with a start, sees him, makes a smiling sob sou of relief and concern as she rises and... Kisses him on the cheek. Holds his hand, tightly.
What happened? He’s smiling...but a hint of shadow falls over his face.
I’1l tell you. CUT TO BLACK. IN BLACKNESS, a WOLF’S HOWL carries from far away, a lone interminable note of sorrow. END.
